title: Home Satsang
content:
Home Satsang Guidelines

A Home Satsang is a sacred gathering of devotees in a home setting to connect with Guruji's divine presence through prayer, meditation, and community. Here is how to conduct a proper Home Satsang:

Preparation

  • Clean and purify the space where the satsang will be held
  • Set up a small altar with Guruji's picture or swaroop
  • Arrange seating on the floor for all participants
  • Prepare prasad (blessed food) for distribution
  • Have tea ready for serving during the gathering

Satsang Structure

1. Opening Prayer

Begin with the Mool Mantra or a silent meditation to invoke Guruji's presence. All participants should close their eyes and focus their thoughts on Guruji.

2. Shabad Kirtan

Sing Gurbani shabads and devotional hymns. Some recommended shabads include:

  • Mool Mantra
  • Japji Sahib
  • Devotional bhajans in praise of the Divine

3. Reading of Guruji's Teachings

Read from Guruji's teachings or share experiences of his divine blessings. Discuss the principles of love, surrender, and service.

4. Silent Meditation

Sit in silence for 10-15 minutes, focusing on Guruji's form and feeling his divine presence in your heart.

5. Ardas (Prayer)

Offer a collective prayer for the well-being of all and seek Guruji's blessings.

6. Prasad Distribution

Distribute the blessed food and tea to all participants. This is considered sacred as it carries Guruji's blessings.

Guidelines for Participants

  • Come with a pure heart and sincere devotion
  • Wear modest, clean clothing
  • Switch off mobile phones during satsang
  • Sit quietly and maintain a meditative atmosphere
  • Share positive experiences and spiritual insights
  • Avoid gossip or negative discussions
  • Respect all fellow devotees

Regular Schedule

It is recommended to hold Home Satsangs weekly or bi-weekly to maintain spiritual discipline and community connection. Many devotees choose Thursday or Sunday evenings.

Shukrana

End every satsang with "Shukrana" â€“ gratitude to Guruji for his infinite blessings and grace. Remember his words: "Kalyan karta" and "Blessings always."

Jai Guruji!
